basics.name: Mikey Wagner
basics.label: Front End Developer
basics.summary: Front End Developer with a love for spicy foods, problem solving, and discovering new music. I create, build, iterate, refactor, and review.
basics.background: Recently, I delivered a highly collaborative and scaled game where Google developers could reveal the date for the upcoming I/O conference by solving interactive puzzles. Previously, I have rapidly architected, implemented, and delivered responsive applications under tight deadlines using Scrum methodologies for companies like Honda, AT&T, AWS, and Intuit. During my time working with Honda, I was given the task of building a prototype for their upcoming car’s dashboard experience, and got to collaborate with the small R&D team. Additionally I was part of the team that built an enterprise level application for AT&T to help businesses dynamically select and configure complex VPN packages.

highlights: Create and maintain responsive web applications across mutiple Google products
Develop and test new features
Participate in code reviews and growth sessions
Debug development and production issues across multiple browsers and devices
Build interactive and dynamic applications for high profile clients (Honda, AT&T, AWS, Intuit) on a fully distributed team using Angular 2+, React, AngularJS, and Vue.
Use scrum methodologies to meet production deadlines and plan sprints.
Maintain and develop features using modern development best practices and design patterns, participate in code reviews, pair programming and testing.
Mentoring new developers and documenting processes.
Work with interactive team to rapidly architect, implement, and deploy E-commerce sites for brand development using JavaScript, C#, Node.js, Asp.Net, jQuery, React, Grunt, and postgreSQL.
Promote best practices and standards while developing with bleeding edge technologies
Designed and developed the music staff widget, a draggable/droppable interface in JavaScript & Python that I created to teach music theory intuitively.
TDD in Jasmine and Karma, hotfixes, feature implementation, and release documentation.
Partnered with a small team of Google developers to develop and test platform.
Rapidly build websites and custom WordPress themes for multiple clients.
Pixel perfect and responsive front-end implementations per designer’s mocks.
Regular maintenance and security updates to existing sites.

work.company: Jack's Mannequin / Andrew McMahon in the Wilderness
highlights: Toured internationally, performed, and released albums on Warner Bros.
Made appearances on television and radio including the Tonight Show, Conan, Jimmy Kimmel, and KROQ.

projects.name: Google IO Save the Date
projects.description: A highly interactive and visually exciting game built for Google developers to collaboratively reveal the dates for the upcoming Google I/O event.
highlights: Built using Preact, MobX, Firebase, PixiJs, and TypeScript
Praised by developers on twitter and reddit for being a fun, challening, and unable to hack

projects.name: AWS AI Game
projects.description: Accomplice teamed up with Accenture to deliver an interactive game that integrated AWS’s machine learning and facial recognition at the 2017 AWS RE:INVENT convention in Las Vegas. Continuously learning from human input, the AI got smarter and smarter as AWS re:Invent went on. With every new player, it picked up new insight and became more skillful. So skillful, in fact, that we had to ultimately tweak the code to make sure it was still fun for participants to play.
highlights: Built using Angular, Amazon Rekognition, and TypeScript
Multi-player game that showcases AWS facial recognition tech
Showcased at AWS convention in Las Vegas

projects.name: Oppia
projects.description: Oppia is an online and open source learning tool that enables anyone to easily create and share interactive activities. These activities, called explorations, simulate a one-on-one conversation with an intelligent tutor. Oppia supports learning by doing. Your exploration can include embedded code editors, dynamic world maps, and many other options for interaction.
highlights: Built using AngularJS, Python, HTML5, jQuery, Bootstrap, Protractor, and Karma
Opensource and highly extensible Ed-Tech platform
Maintained by a small team of Google developers
